name: Hungary
description: Hungary, officially the Republic of Hungary, is a landlocked country in Central Europe. Known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural landscapes, Hungary boasts a diverse geography ranging from the Great Hungarian Plain to the Carpathian Mountains. It’s a country of thermal springs, charming towns, and a unique blend of Eastern and Western European influences.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The heart of Hungary, a city divided by the Danube River, renowned for its architecture and thermal baths.
quickFacts.detail: Budapest was formed in 1873 by the amalgamation of Buda, Pest, and Óbuda.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Hungary has a population of approximately 9.7 million people, predominantly Hungarian.
quickFacts.detail: The vast majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly in Budapest.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Hungary's area encompasses a mix of fertile plains and mountainous regions.
quickFacts.detail: It's the 97th largest country in the world by area.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: Hungarian (Magyar) is a Uralic language, unrelated to most other European languages.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Hungary is the Hungarian Forint.
quickFacts.detail: The Forint has a long and complex history, experiencing significant fluctuations over time.

quickFacts.label: Official Religion
quickFacts.description: Hungary has a religiously diverse population, with a significant portion identifying as unaffiliated.
quickFacts.detail: Historically, the country was predominantly Catholic.

climateData.title: Hungarian Climate
climateData.description: Hungary experiences a temperate continental climate with warm summers and cold winters. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year, though the northwest tends to be wetter.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with blossoming trees and wildflowers transforming the landscape. It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are warm and sunny, with average temperatures ranging from 20°C to 30°C (68°F to 86°F). It's ideal for swimming and water sports.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and vibrant fall foliage. It's a beautiful time for hiking and exploring the countryside.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are cold and snowy, with average temperatures ranging from -2°C to 5°C (28°F to 41°F). It's a time for cozying up by the fireplace and enjoying winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Balaton
naturalWonders.description: Lake Balaton is the largest lake in Central Europe, renowned for its stunning beauty and recreational opportunities. It's a popular destination for swimming, sailing, and enjoying the Hungarian sunshine.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed during the last Ice Age, Lake Balaton boasts a unique microclimate and diverse flora and fauna. Its shallow waters and sandy beaches make it ideal for families.
viewingTips: Visit during the summer months for the warmest water.
Take a boat trip to explore the lake's hidden coves.

naturalWonders.name: Aggtelek National Park
naturalWonders.description: Aggtelek National Park is home to the impressive Postkupa Cave System, one of the largest cave systems in Europe. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showcasing stunning stalactites and stalagmites.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The caves are formed in limestone and are adorned with unique geological formations. The park also features a beautiful karst landscape with forests and waterfalls.
viewingTips: Book a guided tour to learn about the cave's geology and history.
Wear comfortable shoes and bring a light jacket.

naturalWonders.name: Kiskunság National Park
naturalWonders.description: Kiskunság National Park is a vast expanse of Hungarian steppe, characterized by its unique flora and fauna. It’s a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s landscape is dominated by grasslands, shrublands, and scattered forests. It’s home to a variety of rare and endangered species, including the Hungarian bustard.

ecosystemData.title: Hungarian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Hungary’s ecosystems are diverse, ranging from the fertile plains of the Great Hungarian Plain to the mountainous regions of the Carpathian Basin. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Hungary's territory is protected as national parks and nature reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Hungary’s forests cover approximately 20% of the country’s land area, providing habitat for a wide range of species.

notableSpecies.name: European Bison
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the Hungarian forests.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Hungary has a significant number of wetlands, including marshes, swamps, and reed beds, which are vital for biodiversity and flood control.

statistics.details: Important stopover site for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: White-tailed Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the wetlands.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Hungary
activities.description: Hungary offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Hungary’s diverse landscapes on foot, from the rolling hills of the Great Hungarian Plain to the rugged mountains of the Carpathian Basin.

activities.name: Budapest to Lake Balaton Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike from Budapest to Lake Balaton, passing through picturesque villages and forests.

activities.name: Aggtelek Cave Hike
activities.description: Explore the trails around Aggtelek National Park, offering stunning views of the cave system and surrounding landscape.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Hungary’s lakes and rivers offer a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Swimming in Lake Balaton
activities.description: Enjoy a refreshing swim in the warm waters of Lake Balaton.

activities.name: Kayaking on the Danube
activities.description: Paddle along the Danube River, enjoying the views of Budapest and its historic landmarks.

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots
clothing.yearRound: Layers of clothing, comfortable walking shoes

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, first-aid kit
